element.name: name
element.label: Input Name
element.key: Name of this IBM Websphere MQ Queue input. (NO SPACES ALLOWED)

element.name: queue_manager_details
element.key: Queue Manager Details

element.name: queue_manager_name
element.label: Queue Manager Name
element.key: The queue manager to connect to.

element.name: queue_manager_host
element.label: Queue Manager Host
element.key: The queue manager host.

element.name: port
element.label: Listener Port
element.key: The Queue Manager Listener port. Defaults to 1414.

element.name: server_connection_channel
element.label: The server connection channel
element.key: The server connection channel.

element.name: mq_user_name
element.label: User Name
element.key: The user name to use when connecting to the Queue Manager. Defaults to spaces.

element.name: mq_password
element.label: Password
element.key: The password to use when connecting to the Queue Manager. Defaults to spaces.

element.name: queues
element.key: Queues

element.name: queue_names
element.label: Queue Names
element.key: The queue names to get messages from. Comma delimited if multiple.

element.name: polling_details
element.key: Polling

element.name: mqinput_interval
element.label: Interval
element.key: How often to run the MQ input script(in seconds). Defaults to 60 seconds.

element.name: persistent_connection
element.label: Persistent Connection
element.key: Keep the queue manager connection open.

element.name: start_process_per_queue
element.label: Create a dedicated process for each queue.
element.key: Start a dedicated process for each queue.

element.name: start_multiple_processes
element.key: Start multiple processes.

element.name: start_number_of_processes
element.label: Number of processes to start. Default 1.
element.key: Start multiple processes.

element.name: handler
element.key: Custom Response Handling

element.name: response_handler
element.label: Response Handler
element.key: Python classname of custom response handler, defaults to DefaultQueueResponseHandler.

element.name: response_handler_args
element.label: Response Handler Arguments
element.key: Response Handler arguments string. key=value,key2=value2. DefaultQueueResponseHandler defaults(see documentation for available options): include_payload=true, use_mqmd_puttime=true, log_payload_as_event=true, payload_quote_char=[doublequote], include_mqmd=false

element.name: sourcetypeFields
spl-ctrl_sourcetypeSelect
element.label: Set sourcetype
element.key: [[ e for e in ['sourcetype'] if form_defaults.get(e) ][0]]
[[ e for e in ['sourcetype'] if form_defaults.get(e) ][0]]

element.name: sourcetype
element.label: Source type
element.key: If this field is left blank, the default value of mqinput will be used for the source type.
_('mqinput') if (value==None or value=='') else value

element.name: spl-ctrl_from_list
element.label: Select source type from list
element.key: Splunk classifies all common data types automatically, but if you're looking for something specific, you can find more source types in the Splunkbase apps browser or online at www.splunkbase.com.
Source type
Set sourcetype field for all events from this source.

element.name: hostFields
element.key: Host

element.name: indexField
element.key: Index
Set the destination index for this source.

element.name: eai:acl.app
element.label: App
element.key: entity['eai:acl']['app'] or ""
